info.description: The Network Cloud APIs provide management of the on-premises clusters and their resources, such as, racks, bare metal hosts, virtual machines, workload networks and more.

AadConfiguration.title: AadConfiguration represents the Azure Active Directory Integration properties.

adminGroupObjectIds.description: The list of Azure Active Directory group object IDs that will have an administrative role on the Kubernetes cluster.

AdministrativeCredentials.title: AdministrativeCredentials represents the admin credentials for the device requiring password-based authentication.

password.description: The password of the administrator of the device used during initialization.

username.description: The username of the administrator of the device used during initialization.

AdministratorConfiguration.title: AdministratorConfiguration represents the administrative credentials that will be applied to the control plane and agent pool nodes in Kubernetes clusters.

adminUsername.description: The user name for the administrator that will be applied to the operating systems that run Kubernetes nodes. If not supplied, a user name will be chosen by the service.

sshPublicKeys.description: The SSH configuration for the operating systems that run the nodes in the Kubernetes cluster. In some cases, specification of public keys may be required to produce a working environment.

AdministratorConfigurationPatch.title: AdministratorConfigurationPatch represents the patching capabilities for the administrator configuration.

sshPublicKeys.description: SshPublicKey represents the public key used to authenticate with a resource through SSH.

AgentOptions.title: AgentOptions are configurations that will be applied to each agent in an agent pool.

hugepagesCount.description: The number of hugepages to allocate.

hugepagesSize.description: The size of the hugepages to allocate.

AgentPool.title: AgentPool represents the agent pool of Kubernetes cluster.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

AgentPoolConfiguration.title: AgentPoolConfiguration specifies the configuration of a pool of nodes.

administratorConfiguration.description: The administrator credentials to be used for the nodes in this agent pool.

agentOptions.description: The configurations that will be applied to each agent in this agent pool.

attachedNetworkConfiguration.description: The configuration of networks being attached to the agent pool for use by the workloads that run on this Kubernetes cluster.

availabilityZones.description: The list of availability zones of the Network Cloud cluster used for the provisioning of nodes in this agent pool. If not specified, all availability zones will be used.

count.description: The number of virtual machines that use this configuration.

labels.description: The labels applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

mode.description: The selection of how this agent pool is utilized, either as a system pool or a user pool. System pools run the features and critical services for the Kubernetes Cluster, while user pools are dedicated to user workloads. Every Kubernetes cluster must contain at least one system node pool with at least one node.

taints.description: The taints applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

upgradeSettings.description: The configuration of the agent pool.

vmSkuName.description: The name of the VM SKU that determines the size of resources allocated for node VMs.

AgentPoolList.title: AgentPoolList represents a list of Kubernetes cluster agent pools.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

AgentPoolPatchParameters.title: AgentPoolPatchParameters represents the body of the request to patch the Kubernetes cluster agent pool.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

AgentPoolPatchProperties.title: AgentPoolPatchProperties represents the properties of an agent pool that can be modified.

administratorConfiguration.description: The configuration of administrator credentials for the control plane nodes.

count.description: The number of virtual machines that use this configuration.

upgradeSettings.description: The configuration of the agent pool.

AgentPoolProperties.title: AgentPoolProperties represents the properties of the Kubernetes cluster agent pool.

administratorConfiguration.description: The administrator credentials to be used for the nodes in this agent pool.

agentOptions.description: The configurations that will be applied to each agent in this agent pool.

attachedNetworkConfiguration.description: The configuration of networks being attached to the agent pool for use by the workloads that run on this Kubernetes cluster.

availabilityZones.description: The list of availability zones of the Network Cloud cluster used for the provisioning of nodes in this agent pool. If not specified, all availability zones will be used.

count.description: The number of virtual machines that use this configuration.

detailedStatus.description: The current status of the agent pool.

detailedStatusMessage.description: The descriptive message about the current detailed status.

kubernetesVersion.description: The Kubernetes version running in this agent pool.

labels.description: The labels applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

mode.description: The selection of how this agent pool is utilized, either as a system pool or a user pool. System pools run the features and critical services for the Kubernetes Cluster, while user pools are dedicated to user workloads. Every Kubernetes cluster must contain at least one system node pool with at least one node.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the agent pool.

taints.description: The taints applied to the nodes in this agent pool.

upgradeSettings.description: The configuration of the agent pool.

vmSkuName.description: The name of the VM SKU that determines the size of resources allocated for node VMs.

AgentPoolUpgradeSettings.title: AgentPoolUpgradeSettings specifies the upgrade settings for an agent pool.

maxSurge.description: The maximum number or percentage of nodes that are surged during upgrade. This can either be set to an integer (e.g. '5') or a percentage (e.g. '50%'). If a percentage is specified, it is the percentage of the total agent pool size at the time of the upgrade. For percentages, fractional nodes are rounded up. If not specified, the default is 1.

AttachedNetworkConfiguration.title: AttachedNetworkConfiguration represents the set of workload networks to attach to a resource.

l2Networks.description: The list of Layer 2 Networks and related configuration for attachment.

l3Networks.description: The list of Layer 3 Networks and related configuration for attachment.

trunkedNetworks.description: The list of Trunked Networks and related configuration for attachment.

AvailableUpgrade.title: AvailableUpgrade represents an upgrade available for a Kubernetes cluster.

BareMetalMachine.title: BareMetalMachine represents the physical machine in the rack.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

BareMetalMachineCommandSpecification.title: BareMetalMachineCommandSpecification represents the command and optional arguments to exercise against the bare metal machine.

arguments.description: The list of string arguments that will be passed to the script in order as separate arguments.

command.description: The command to execute against the bare metal machine.

BareMetalMachineConfigurationData.title: BareMetalMachineConfigurationData represents configuration for the bare metal machine.

bmcConnectionString.description: The connection string for the baseboard management controller including IP address and protocol.

bmcCredentials.description: The credentials of the baseboard management controller on this bare metal machine.

bmcMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the BMC for this machine.

bootMacAddress.description: The MAC address associated with the PXE NIC card.

The maximum time the script is allowed to run.
If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

The maximum time the commands are allowed to run.
If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

CloudServicesNetwork.description:
Upon creation, the additional services that are provided by the platform will be allocated and
represented in the status of this resource. All resources associated with this cloud services network will be part
of the same layer 2 (L2) isolation domain. At least one service network must be created but may be reused across many
virtual machines and/or Hybrid AKS clusters.

NetworkAttachment.title: NetworkAttachment represents the single network attachment.

attachedNetworkId.description:
The resource ID of the associated network attached to the virtual machine.
It can be one of cloudServicesNetwork, l3Network, l2Network or trunkedNetwork resources.

defaultGateway.description:
The indicator of whether this is the default gateway.
Only one of the attached networks (including the CloudServicesNetwork attachment) for a single machine may be specified as True.

ipAllocationMethod.description:
The IP allocation mechanism for the virtual machine.
Dynamic and Static are only valid for l3Network which may also specify Disabled.
Otherwise, Disabled is the only permitted value.

ipv4Address.description:
The IPv4 address of the virtual machine.

This field is used only if the attached network has IPAllocationType of IPV4 or DualStack.

If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv4 address from within the subnet specified in the attached network.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the attached network.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

ipv6Address.description:
The IPv6 address of the virtual machine.

This field is used only if the attached network has IPAllocationType of IPV6 or DualStack.

If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain an IPv6 address range from within the range specified in the attached network.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an range from within the subnet specified in the attached network.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the interface for the virtual machine that corresponds to this network attachment.

networkAttachmentName.description:
The associated network's interface name.
If specified, the network attachment name has a maximum length of 15 characters and must be unique to this virtual machine.
If the user doesn’t specify this value, the default interface name of the network resource will be used.
For a CloudServicesNetwork resource, this name will be ignored.

serviceCidrs.description: The CIDR notation IP ranges from which to assign service IPs. One IPv4 CIDR is expected for single-stack networking. Two CIDRs, one for each IP family (IPv4/IPv6), is expected for dual-stack networking.

volumes.description: The resource IDs of volumes that are attached to the virtual machine.

Volume.title: Volume represents storage made available for use by resources running on the cluster.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

VolumeList.title: VolumeList represents a list of volumes.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

VolumePatchParameters.title: VolumePatchParameters represents the body of the request to patch the volume resource.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

VolumeProperties.title: VolumeProperties represents properties of the volume resource.

attachedTo.description: The list of resource IDs that attach the volume. It may include virtual machines and Hybrid AKS clusters.

detailedStatus.description: The more detailed status of the volume.

detailedStatusMessage.description: The descriptive message about the current detailed status.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the volume.

serialNumber.description: The unique identifier of the volume.

sizeMiB.description: The size of the allocation for this volume in Mebibytes.
